com.avaya.csta.registration

Interface RegistrationListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RegistrationAdapter

    public interface RegistrationListener
extends java.util.EventListener
    Initiates an event monitor listening for RegistrationServices unregistration events for a specified terminal. These events include:
    • TerminalUnregisteredEvent
    This listener is used to notify an application if the terminal is unregistered by the server so that the application can act upon the event notification. See Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API to learn more about how to use listeners.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      void terminalReregistered(TerminalReregisteredEvent event)

    • Method Detail

      • terminalUnregistered

        void terminalUnregistered(TerminalUnregisteredEvent event)
        Callback method that is called when the terminal is unregistered from the switching function. This event occurs when the switching function unregisters the terminal (for whatever reason). A reason for the unregistration will be present in the event. See the TerminalUnregisteredEvent for more information.

        The device parameter that specifies the device that is registered is of type SubjectDeviceID so extracting the device ID is a two-step process: 

         SubjectDeviceID subjDeviceID = event.getDevice();
 DeviceID deviceID = subjDeviceID.getDeviceIdentifier();

        An example of how getReason() and getCode() might be used is shown below: 

         // Check to see if terminal was automically unregistered because of network
 // timeout
 if (event.getCode().equals(RegistrationConstants.NETWORK_TIME_OUT) {
     System.out.println("unregistered: Code: " + event.getCode()
         + " Reason: " + event.getReason());
     System.out.println("Will try to re-register after waiting 30 secs.");
     Thread.sleep(30000);
     // Try to re-register in case network problems were temporary.
     ...
 }
        Parameters:
        event - indication that the terminal is now unregistered. Use event.getReason() or event.getCode()to determine the cause of the unregistration.

      • terminalReregistered

        void terminalReregistered(TerminalReregisteredEvent event)
        Callback method that is called when the terminal is unregistered from the switching function and re-registered with a different switch. This event occurs when the switching function fails over to a different switch (an ESS or LSP, or back to Main). See the TerminalReregisteredEvent for more information.

        The device parameter that specifies the device that is registered is of type SubjectDeviceID so extracting the device ID is a two-step process: 

         SubjectDeviceID subjDeviceID = event.getDevice();
 DeviceID deviceID = subjDeviceID.getDeviceIdentifier();

        Parameters:
        event - indication that the terminal has unregistered from its previous switch, and registered with another switch.
